description:
Nova fails to start instances on compute nodes when the base OS (CentOS 7) is installed with a locale other than en_US.UTF-8 (e.g. es_ES.UTF-8).

To avoid this bug, the base system should always be installed with locale "en_US.UTF-8" (US English) on all nodes, esp. Compute nodes.

This has been reported to RedHat RDO here:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1190837

title: Nova may not start instances when OS is installed with locale not en_US

comments.content:
Nova fails to start instances on compute nodes when the base OS (CentOS 7) is installed with a locale other than en_US.UTF-8 (e.g. es_ES.UTF-8).

To avoid this bug, the base system should always be installed with locale "en_US.UTF-8" (US English).

This has been reported to RedHat RDO here:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1190837

    Fix bad exception logging

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~hudson-openstack

comments.content:
This bug is invalid and is a case of a bad translation

http://paste.openstack.org/show/190502


# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

print("good:")
print(u"test %s" % u'á')
print("good:")
print("test %s" % 'á')
print("bad:")
print(u"test %s" % 'á')
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo

comments.content: Concatenating the exception which might have a unicode string in it with the ascii debug log message is a bug and was fixed here, but there is a better way to fix this, which is bug 1430383.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem
